description: Gets the names of the key policies that are attached to a KMS key. This operation is designed to get policy names that you can use in a  GetKeyPolicy operation. However, the only valid policy name is default. Cross-account use: No. You cannot perform this operation on a KMS key in a different Amazon Web Services account. Required permissions: kms:ListKeyPolicies (key policy) Eventual consistency: The KMS API follows an eventual consistency model. For more information, see KMS eventual consistency.

parameters.name: KeyId
parameters.description: Gets the names of key policies for the specified KMS key. Specify the key ID or key ARN of the KMS key. For example: Key ID: 1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab Key ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab To get the key ID and key ARN for a KMS key, use  ListKeys or  DescribeKey.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: Use this parameter to specify the maximum number of items to return. When this value is present, KMS does not return more than the specified number of items, but it might return fewer. This value is optional. If you include a value, it must be between 1 and 1000, inclusive. If you do not include a value, it defaults to 100. Only one policy can be attached to a key.

nested_items.name: PolicyNames
nested_items.description: A list of key policy names. The only valid value is default.

nested_items.name: NextMarker
nested_items.description: When Truncated is true, this element is present and contains the value to use for the Marker parameter in a subsequent request.

nested_items.name: Truncated
nested_items.description: A flag that indicates whether there are more items in the list. When this value is true, the list in this response is truncated. To get more items, pass the value of the NextMarker element in this response to the Marker parameter in a subsequent request.
